description: Mystery Room is a new real-life room escape game that locks participants in a room from which they have one hour to escape. Participants usually play as teams. Once inside the room, the players must use imagination, logical thinking,and teamwork to solve the tricky clues that are hidden about the room. Only by solving these clues can they obtain the codes to unlock the doors an escape!

reviews.title: Chainsaw Massacre - kind staff and average rooms
text: We unknowingly booked an escape room in downsview instead of at the downtown location. Even though the two locations are owned by different people, the lovely lady at the desk was able to access our booking, cancelled it - as we would no longer be able to make it - and gave us a discount on the Chainsaw Massacre room to offset the deposit we had paid, and we only had to wait 50 minutes until we could do a room.
The entrance had seating and games such as connect 4 and Jenga, but it is a requirement that you remove your shoes upon entry which may be difficult for some people.

The room itself was slightly disappointing. Some of the clues were disjointed and would have been impossible to deduce without hints for anyone. Overall, the room was styled well, but while I would recommend it for people who are new to escape rooms, it was a little disappointing to our family who have participated in a few really cool escape rooms.

reviews.title: Family fun night at Mystery Room
text: Our family of 4 did the Vampire's Castle game at Mystery Room. It was so much fun. Good clues and engaging for my teens. The staff were helpful if we had questions. We will be back to try one of the other rooms. Young children might find some of the rooms a little scary, but definitely great for teens.

reviews.title: Silent House is really fun
text: This game is amazing!  The original game is from PS4 PT!
The game is  absolutely amazing, it let you feels like you are in the PT game!!

reviews.title: Awesome Experience!
text: This review is for the two Dundas Street West locations in Downtown Toronto. My boyfriend and I have done all the rooms at these locations and we have had a blast! Teresa and Al were there when we have come and they were both awesome Game Masters! They were funny, gave great hints, and made the escape room experience more enjoyable! Definitely recommend this location for Escape Room enthusiasts.

reviews.title: Work bonding!
text: I have been wanting to do an escape room with my colleagues for years. Finally did one with 3 of us with our spouses. We did Black Beard's Curse! It was a great experience with multiple rooms! The puzzles were tricky, but not impossible so it was very rewarding to figure them out.  My only critique is that the puzzle was rather linear. Like, you knew exactly what you had to figure out, so, with 6 people, only a few of us were doing all the puzzles while the others were sort of wandering around looking for other things.  I would say 4 people is perfect for this one.

I loved the fact that they don't book multiple groups in the same room and time slot!! I've been paired with some dead-weight groups before at other escape rooms and really brings down the experience. Like, "I don't care how I work with you, Stranger!" Mystery Room makes sure that once a time slot has some one signed up, it's their slot! Really made the difference.
Price is pretty normal for escape rooms. Actually, $20 is on the cheaper side.
I would recommend this to any group that is sort of new to escape rooms.

reviews.title: Not worth $20 a person.
text: We did the Pandemic room and it was very low quality. The room was very cheaply put together, most things were being held up by ducktape. The clues weren't very elaborate like other escape rooms in the city. The app you're supposed to use for the game didn't work for three of our players. The employs weren't the nicest. Not worth $20 a person.

reviews.title: Poor quality game
text: We made a last minute reservation ad we were surprised that we were able to get it so easily. By the time we left, we realized why they aren't too busy. We were the only ones there on a weekday evening.

I'll start off with the girl at reception. She was friendly and nice and asked us to read the rules. She then showed us the room and explained that the digital locks will lock out for 5 minutes after 3 failed attempts. She set the timer and walked out. No story or explanation.

The first room had clues which didn't make much sense, so we had to ask for her help 3 times. We were stuck in there for 20 minutes, not because it was too challenging, but because it didn't really add up. We figured out the clue, but she had to tell us that the numbers were off because of the interpretation of the clue, which didn't make sense. There was one decent clue after that, but the rest of the rooms were so easy, it was comical. The answers were practically written right there for you. After our 20 minutes in the first room, we finished the remainder in under 15 minutes.

The last room before you escape is right in the reception area, only separated by jail bars. While we were in there, the receptionist was chatting on the phone the entire time! It was so rude and distracting. Once we escaped, she rushed us out, so she could get back to her phone call.
This was not our first escape game, so we expected a lot more, but were very disappointed.
I would not recommend this place at all.
It was also very expensive for the quality of the rooms.

reviews.title: Family visiting from the States - Had a great time
text: I had family visiting from the states with two teenagers.  We booked Assassin's Code online and had a great time.  Staff was friendly and accommodating and the price was reasonable.  The room was a challenge, though we were able to solve it in roughly 45 minutes.  We did have to get one tip.  From the outside, the location is unassuming and is easy to pass with all the colorourful signs of Chinatown.

reviews.title: Fell short of expectations but still fun
text: We were a group of nine in the Pandemic Room at the Richmond Hill (West Beaver Creek Road) location.  The room supposedly accommodates up to 10 but our group found we were tripping over one another.

It was a great concept and using our phones (or theirs in some instances) was neat but came with technical difficulties.  One of the borrowed phones wouldn't scan resources and so that player "died" very early on and the staff couldn't reactivate their character.  Scanning the bar codes required you to use a flashlight on another phone as the ambient light in the room was insufficient for the scanner to work.

The other props were basic but adequate.  A bit of fine tuning would enhance the game tremendously.  The young man at the front desk was friendly and did his best to make our time enjoyable but was overwhelmed and so didn't explain the setup terribly well.  Consequently we also used an emergency exit to inadvertently circumvent part of the game to get into a subsequent room.

reviews.title: Pandemic Room is awesome
text: Really Really fun room !! You get to play with your cellphone, it track your HP , hungry and thirsty and solving puzzle at same time!

reviews.title: Fun way to spend an hour
text: It was our first time in a Mystery Room and we loved it!!! It was well done (even though I understand from other reviews that there may be other locations that are better?). The staff were amazing and helpful not only at the game but also helping us find our way after!
Would definitely return again!

reviews.title: Not a fun experience
text: I've been to half a dozen escape rooms, and this is by far the worst.  Rooms were in bad condition, and the puzzles were simple.

reviews.title: Very disappointing
text: Read the very mixed reviews about this game, but decided to try it out, as we had a couple of hours to spare one morning and this was the only escape game in Toronto that opened early on a weekday. The rooms and props were very tatty and tacky and far too many of the props were off limits, so there weren't enough props for our group of 6 to explore. When we asked for a hint or clue at one point the employee came in and just told us where the key was. This immediately put an end to that section of the game. We all lost interest very quickly and were glad when the game was over. Extremely poor quality compared to the 2 previous escape games we played in Germany. Would hate for anyone else to waste their money and be as disappointed as us!

reviews.title: Not worth the money spent
text: This was my second time doing an escape room.  The quality of this one was very poor!  There were some good puzzle elements but the decor is very cheap and had a halloween feeling.  The quality is very childish.  I didn't like that I could hear people on the outside playing foosball and the receptionist taking phone calls. Also, the worker walked in several times to mention things to us...which we found very unprofessional.  We had an hour to escape and were done with 20 minutes to spare...which says something about the little amount that is put into this room.  There should be way more to solve.  Too small, very wimpy, pretty easy.

reviews.title: Tomb explorer -- fun first experience
text: Our first experience at an escape room. There are games like Jenga you can play in the waiting area if you arrive early, There are lockers to put your personal items and water cooler if you are thirsty (you can feel thirsty and hot after being under pressure to escape for 1hr). We did the Tomb explorer and we had a lot of fun that we wanted to try another escape room the following day; however, we wanted to try a different location to get a different experience. Loved the multi-room escape because there's a feeling of accomplishment when you can escape one room and go into another. There was one really cool tech, that we all love. We did escape with hints, but it was so much fun. The sound system should have been louder. Overall, we really enjoyed our experience. Props 7/10, Service 9/10,

reviews.title: Hotrible
text: Had gone with a group of 11 ppl. All different ages. It was horrible. There were no clues the "puzzles" were useless.
We had a nurse of 20+ years, a space enginer, an accountant and over 20 years of university education and we could not get through the rooms.
Biggest waste of $400+ evwr.

reviews.title: needs repair and updating
text: This was my first experience at an escape room... It was a lot of fun! We really enjoyed ourselves! But this location in particular wasn't the greatest.  We went to the North York location and chose the Prison Break escape.  A few of the "escape tools" were broken or didn't work so we lost a lot of time.  The very last clue didn't even work (confirmed by staff) so this was a little frustrating. There's better escape rooms out there.
Escape rooms: a good time
Mystery Room: go somewhere else

reviews.title: NOT the "ONE"
text: I've been to Escape Games just down the street and had an absolute blast. Mystery rooms however falls far short of that experience. It's amateur hour at best! First off, the rooms are so open and poorly sound proofed that if there is another group there completing a different game it feels like they are in the room with you, it can become very disrupting and can throw you off focus!! The rooms are in bad shape and in definite need of some paint. A shelf in one of the rooms (that had nothing to do with the game) fell off and struck one of my friends square in the head! Also, we were with a group of 6 and booked 2 rooms, costing us 240$ combined so an intro video with some sort of story background would've been nice, Lastly, I don't mind the addition of some "red herrings" but there were just way too many switches, buttons, room accessoires that had NOTHING to do with the puzzle. It doesn't take much to hide these or at least mark them off properly!! okay i feel better now! AND ANOTHER THING The puzzles themselves were not bad and I didn't mind the difficulty,(though there was more math than I wouldv'e liked) Just small things that can be easily changed to make them stand out among top escape rooms!

reviews.title: SATAN'S LAIR room
text: It's a first time, that I played this game in reality. I loved it.

It was like a brain storming: think, think fast, search, find. everyone working as a team. First room we expected to be a bit easier for a start, but i wasn't. We lost some time in there, but then when you are on the "Wave" - it goes easier. We didn't break the record, but we got out!
"Feeling smart and appreciating team members"
Location: easy to find if you are driving, but a bit to far from a subway. The design is ok. They had some interesting Halloween toys.
Inside the rooms, I wasn't impressed, I wouldn't call it a Satan rooms. Scary pictures, dark walls and low light - that's just a scary room for a kid.
But  we came there to play,  and the play was good.
I'm definitely trying other rooms and locations!

reviews.title: MEH
text: I expected a whole lot more in regards to the theme. Without giving anything away I was somewhat unimpressed with the lack of visual stimulation regarding the rooms. "Satan's Lair" was more or less a crummy office space with some cheap halloween decorations. For a group of 8 we paid close to $160, I expected some red paint on the wall and at bare minimum a pitchfork in the corner or a lock combo of "666".

reviews.title: GOOD EXPERIENCE
text: We just finished the Duel with Devil, that room is hardest one in their game zone but we beat it!!!  wow the room is amazing. good experience, we will back for sure. your guys should try it ^@^

reviews.title: First Escape Room - It was fun!
text: It was fun! A good amount of puzzles to solve as you work your way through a couple of rooms. Except at one point the lights went off in one of the rooms, a manager came in to check on us. We were in the 2nd room and didn't really even notice the lights off in the other room. Then he asked how we opened a box without finding a different clue. We told him and he said "oops, that shouldn't have been in there" kind of ruining the rest of the game? so we spent about 5 minutes trying to figure out how to get the other clue just out of curiosity. But it was a bit dissapointing and we weren't compensated for them not setting up the room properly -- $88 for an hour (4 people x $22 each) and you kind of expect the room to be well set up? We finished it with 20 minutes to spare (even after spending the extra time trying to figure out the clue that we didn't need). It was still pretty fun and we were ready to do another but they were sold out.

reviews.title: Fun for first timers- huge disappointment for regulars
text: We made the mistake of doing a room at the original Escape Rooms the night before doing one here. There is no comparison. Mystery Rooms needs to be updated (broken equipment, cheap decorations, wear down on items, etc). They were a huge disappointment compared to the challenge and intrigue of the original games. Our two friends who had never tried an escape game enjoyed it, but they were also put off by the broken equipment and some of the nonsensical clues.
I would highly recommended that you go to the original escape rooms.

reviews.title: Duel with the Devil -- fun for a first time!
text: This is my first time doing an Escape Room, so I can't compare the decor to other venues, like some of the other reviews have, however, will rate my own experience. The staff helped when we needed, without giving too much away. Fun!

reviews.title: Terrible, rip off
text: First mystery room ever done and think I was totally ripped off for $22 EACH. Previous reviews are right about the awful decor, I spotted clues from seeing parts having been worn away in certain areas (could see button under picture from the paint/plastic being worn away on top etc). There was a gun to shoot obstacles, but the way the obstacles were positioned I could see the clue without even shooting! The last room was a joke, couple magnets and boom that's it, then at the end no congratulations or photo op or anything. We were done with 20 mins to spare, I asked if we could try another room for the last 20 and was denied.
WOULD NOT RECOMMEND.

reviews.title: Jank - huge waste of money
text: This mystery room was the crappiest experience I've had - which is a huge disappointment considering how fun some of the other escape/mystery room establishments are!

Half of the things didn't work - the employees had to keep coming into the room and resetting things.  The place was dingy  and felt filthy.  Just terrible.   We did the Assasin's code game - but I can't imagine that any of the others are better given what we experienced.

reviews.title: Great puzzles, but a lousy entourage
text: On our trip through Canada we ended up in the nation's capitol, Toronto, where we did two escape rooms, both in the Mystery Room. Both rooms (Satan's Lair & the Haunted Hospital) had a great set of creative and inspiring cool puzzles, which already makes the rooms worthwhile to visit. On the downside, the whole scenery is well... absent. It's just an empty white room with attributes. Also, the phone system that is used for asking for hints was not working properly (twice!!). And lastly, you could hear the other people that where doing the other rooms clearly, which takes a bit away from the overall experience.

reviews.title: A good time for a first escape room
text: Like some of the other reviews have mentioned, the decor and build quality of the rooms is kind of tacky and cheap. That being said, the concepts of the puzzles were pretty cool and we had a great time solving them (and setting a record, woo!). If the build quality improved it'd be a more immersive experience, but we still had fun.

reviews.title: Cops and robbers, good for beginners
text: This was our second escape room type of experience and it was fun. The cops and robbers one is for beginners no doubt but still interesting. It is a little tacky but it's all in good fun. They require a minimum amount of people to play the games, so make sure you call to find out how many are required for each game before you go.

reviews.title: Hard To Accept...
text: Mystery Room is an interesting Escape Room company with 2 downtown store fronts facing each other on opposite sides of Dundas St. W in the heart of Chinatown...  One would think with such an advantageous location they'd want to dominate the market and produce some good quality escape rooms.  Sadly this is NOT the case!  Their props frequently break, their puzzles are poorly designed, and their game masters (store managers?) are unaware there's a very large network of enthusiasts, reviewers and/or consultants who know a LOT about escape rooms.  To be told poorly designed puzzles, or a broken props, or red herrings are ''intentionally designed'' isn't just frustrating, it shows disregard toward the customer and presumes they aren't smart enough to know the difference between a good quality room and a poor one that only stays afloat because of its location...

reviews.title: Effortless on all fronts
text: The room was clearly put together without much thought or effort. The paint was sloppy, instructions were printed on paper and taped all around, the ceiling tiles were out of place (not on purpose), there was an easy-to-open "emergency exit" which both led you outside AND to the next room (which you were supposed to get to using clues) didn't make sense given the main entrance was close to it, and the puzzle clues were extremely easy to find. The props were very cheap as well. I could go on, but the staff was friendly, so I'll stop.
The entire experience was embarrassing.
Escape to another location.

reviews.title: Fun and Challenging - but It needs some repairs and a swiffer.
text: My friend and I did the Clown Room and some other room at the Dundas St location. What was interesting is that both of these rooms are across the street from each other. They have two physical locations on Dundas St.
The lovely girl who worked there was a pleasure. The Clown Room was basic and challenging and enjoyable. It had multiple rooms and was fun.

The room across the street that featured an 'Indiana Jones' theme. Was filthy, and dirty. Some of the ways to solve clues had technical issues. This was a more challenging one. They both were great, and we had fun, but the rooms needed a bit of a cleaning as did the venue.
I only gave it four stars because I enjoyed myself, and loved the challenge and each escape had multiple rooms (involving crawling!)
Guys, clean the place up! :) and fix up and repair some of the things!

reviews.title: Horrible, horrible escape room
text: My friends and I have been to multiple escape rooms and this is by far the worst place I've been to.

We did 'The Curse of the Mummy'. THEY FORGOT 2 CLUES!!!!! And then they lied to us about them being there the whole time. When we asked for a hint, they realized they screwed up, and snuck back in to slip the clue in (when we didnt ask them to for a hint). Worst experience ever. Don't go here!!

reviews.title: Amazing time
text: Visited today with friends. We had an amazing time. We did the mummy room in 1 hour and 26 minutes. We were given extra time as it took forever for someone to come to help with the clues as it started with only one worker there who was greeting new people and also having to handle the rooms. All in all we definitely would return. We really did have a blast. Just they should ensure extra staff on weekends.

reviews.title: Nice mystery room. Fun!
text: This is a nice mystery room to introduce you into the genre. Puzzles were hard but do-able. Friendly staff!

reviews.title: This place is brutal.
text: We spent 88.00 for all 4 of us to do a room (curse of the mummy). Dumb clues and the same type of puzzle over and over again. The rooms are cheap looking and old. Never been to an escape room before and thought it would be fun. And maybe if we had gone elsewhere it would have been. This place is so lame I would not go back for free. Hated it. Seriously I have a hard time believing any positive reviews for this place are legit.

reviews.title: Exciting and fun
text: I went to many escape games before, this one is the best one. We played "Duel with the Devil" last week. It's really fun but really hard. There are lots of high tech puzzels and equipments in the game. That's super exciting. I also like the multiple rooms, we nned go though 4 rooms and unlock 5 doors in order to escape. We made it in 54 mins. Staffs are very nice, they helped us take funny pictures. As a group of 6, we all had good experiences. We highly recomend go and have a try. You will like it!

reviews.title: Very fun
text: This is probably our second favorite escape place after Escape Games down the street. We have done two of their rooms and both were well though-out and fun with different rooms and challenges. The clue system was a little confusing.

reviews.title: Very immersive experience!
text: I went with a group of four and tried out the Assassin's Code room at the downtown Toronto location. It was our first experience with escape rooms, so we weren't sure what to expect. I believe this location was still under construction at the time, so we had to run across the street to make a payment. A bit inconvenient, but not much of a hassle.

When we went into the room, the receptionist briefed us on the storyline - your fiancee has been kidnapped and you have one hour to save her. The room was made to look like a hotel room and they did a very good job setting it up. Furniture was somewhat outdated (perhaps it was supposed to be a low budget inn?) but the overall setting was nice. The technical components provided an excellent touch - there was a TV that showed us surveillance sequences and clips so it it seemed like you were watching a character in the game in real time, which was an excellent feature. We had a couple technical difficulties with the phone prop, however nothing that ruined the experience.

Even though we did not manage to escape in time, we all has such a blast working together solving the puzzles. The theatrical features were nice and it truly made you feel like you were immersed in the storyline.

reviews.title: Let the mummy wake you up!
text: It's my first time playing escape room, we had the "revenge of the mummy".  Lucky, we made it within 53 mins. Oh don't forget they have some costumes at the hall way which you can take pictures with. Anyways, we had a great day with the escape room, i hope you guys do too!
